page.title: 11EAST RIDING DIALECT
page.content: {HOLDERNESS PEOPLE }have different patterns of speech from the rest of the country.The sayings include:- "Swineys"for Sowthistles,"Climmeye" for Convolvulus,"Airruff"for Goose Grass,"Wicks"for Couch Grass,"a Shim,"a Dutch Hoe,"Taffled up"for entangled,"Flummaxt"for upset,agitated "App it up"for cover it up "Appins"for bedcovers "telegawpin"for watching television."Allright" means the item is acceptable. "Gobsmacked"means awstruck,"Orf" is a local farming word, which the vets are not familiar with, referring to a sort of sheep impetigo. "Teeming down" means raining, whilst teeming straw means to unload it."While" can mean until e.g."Hold this while I get back.
